_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Phillips 66 Glenpool Products Terminal in Glenpool, Oklahoma is committed to providing a

safe work environment for employees and to being a responsible corporate citizen. Phillips 66

believes that excellent performance in the areas of health, environment, safety and security goes

hand-in-hand with operational excellence and financial success. In fulfilling this commitment, the

Phillips 66 Glenpool Products Terminal will comply with regulatory requirements and provide

and maintain a safe working environment using acceptable and proven business practices. All

Phillips 66 employees will strive to identify and eliminate hazards which could result in injury and

illness, damage to the environment, property damage, and security losses.



The Phillips 66 Glenpool Products Terminal is operated and maintained in a manner that

protects the environment, as well as the health and safety of its employees, contractors and the

community in which it operates. Phillips 66 promotes health, safety, and the environment through

programs of awareness, compliance, prevention and protection. These programs include a

combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning. This summary

provides a brief overview of the risk management activities that we have designed and implemented.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



Phillips 66 Glenpool Products Terminal is a light products, bulk petroleum storage facility used

in the storage and distribution of petroleum products to retail and commercial end-users in the

vicinity of Glenpool, Oklahoma. The Terminal handles and stores various grades of unleaded

gasoline, low-diesel fuel, and additives. The Phillips 66 Glenpool Products Terminal complies

with Process Safety Regulations in the covered process which encompasses the Butane unloading

station, Butane storage vessel, valves, pump, associated piping and ancillary equipment. Butane is

stored in one vessel and transferred to/blended with gasol

ine (product rack injection and pipeline

injection) through the use of a fixed piping system and injection skid.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMS



Phillips 66's accidental release prevention programs and emergency planning and response

programs help effectively manage the hazards posed by the facility's regulated substance to

employees/contractors, the public, and the environment. The covered process is regulated by the

EPA RMP regulation 40 CFR Part 68 and the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard 29CFR

1910.119. The following accident prevention programs are in place at the Phillips 66 Glenpool Products Terminal:



1) Employee Participation,

2) Process Safety Information,

3) Process Hazard Analysis (PHA),

4) Standard Operating Procedures,

5) Operator Training,

6) Contractors,

7) Pre-startup Safety Review,

8) Mechanical Integrity,

9) Hazardous Work Authorization (Hot Work, etc.),

10) Management of Change,

11) Incident Investigation,

12) Emergency Procedures/Planning,

13) Compliance Audits, and

14) Trade Secrets.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



As this is a new process/stationary system there have been no accidents within the past five (5)

years as defined in 40 CFR Part 68.42.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



The Phillips 66 Glenpool Products Terminal Facility Response Plan provides the essential

planning and training for protecting employees, the public, and the environment during emergency

situations. Contained within the Plan are written procedures that outline the actions to be taken for

various types of emergencies that could occur in the facility. These emergencies may include:

airborne releases of chemical substances, spills to the water or ground, fires, explosions, and

personnel medical emergencies.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Phillips 66 is continually striving to make the Phillips 66 Glenpool Products Terminal the safest and most reliable workplace possible for its employees, neighbors and commun

ity. The facility's focus is safe, reliable, and environmentally sound operations. The goal of the Phillips 66 Glenpool Products Terminal is to demonstrate continuous improvement in its health, environmental and safety performance. In addition, Phillips 66 will work cooperatively with our neighbors to ensure the health, environment, safety and security of the Phillips 66 Glenpool Products Terminal and surrounding community.
